sections.heading: Governor to administer program in accordance with Federal Highway Safety Act.Section 32-13-2 - Participation by subordinate political subdivisions.
sections.text:
32-13-1. Governor to administer program in accordance with Federal Highway Safety Act.

The Governor shall administer the highway safety program within this state and authorize, direct, and coordinate existing and future activities of agencies of this state and its political subdivisions in the program. The Governor shall do all things necessary to the administration of the program under the Federal Highway Safety Act of 1966, Public Law 89-564, as amended and in effect on July 1, 1984.

Source: SL 1967, ch 120, §1; SL 1984, ch 12, §20; SL 2023, ch 3, §36.

sections.heading: Participation by subordinate political subdivisions.
sections.text:
32-13-2. Participation by subordinate political subdivisions.

Subject to the provisions of §32-13-1, the political subdivisions of this state are hereby authorized and empowered to participate in said state and federal highway safety programs and do all acts necessary to carry out the purposes thereof.

Source:SL 1967, ch 120, §2.
